bibl.title: Text & Context for the Illustrated Herbal from Tebtunis.
bibl.note: Text and commentary of P. Tebt. II, 679 + P. Tebt. Tait 39-41 (= Marganne 176 + 178-180; Mertens-Pack3 2094). II century CE. - Pp. 601-604: Appendix: P. Tebt. II, 679 = 'T26'. Discusses the meaning of the 'T-numbers'. The herbal perhaps enjoyed a special relationship with the priestly family of Isidora, Kronion, and their son Pakebkis, domiciled within the precinct walls of the temple of Soknebtunis.
